meeting.gapAnalysisText: This tool is meant to help customers make an informed decision for optional creditor insurance based on their circumstances/responses in the event of a reduction or loss of income and to understand the benefits of the coverage.
meeting.noteThatText:
For simplicity, the maximum insurable limit for both balance and payment protection based on an installment loan has been used.

The financial information requested to complete this worksheet will only be used by your financial institution to discuss Creditor Insurance products with you and will not be used for any other purpose. The information will not be retained or shared outside of this completed worksheet, which may be saved to your profile and can be provided to you upon request.
meeting.allFields: Most fields are optional. Mandatory fields are marked with an asterisk.
meeting.allFieldsText: Ensure that all required mandatory fields are completed before reviewing the results. Do not distribute incomplete results to customers.
meeting.pre-existingText: If you’re unable to complete all questions with your customer, save a draft of your completed work in PDF format on your device. The option to save your progress on your device is available on the Results Page. After saving the PDF with the started but unfinished responses, you can seamlessly resume where you left off by uploading it here.
meeting.borrowerTooltip: If the co-borrower and borrower are not part of the same household it's suggested to complete the analysis separately (i.e., one for each household). This tool displays a maximum of 2 borrowers.

income.lastText: Income tax rates vary between provinces/territories. The above is only an estimation of income after federal and provincial taxes. The actual customer net income will differ based on personal circumstances such as tax credit(s), RRSP contributions and more.
income.bonusesTooltip: Bonuses, commissions and overtime will be impacted by a reduction of income and not covered by LTD insurance.
income.rentalTooltip: Rental and investment won't be affected by a base income reduction and won't be covered by LTD Insurance.

assets.title: Liabilities/Debts
assets.subTitle: Enter total amount owed for all borrowers for all existing liabilities/debts.
assets.liabilitiesTooltip: Credit card, personal loan and other loans. For refinance, exclude the current balance from this field and enter the total new mortgage/loan in the new mortgage/loan field.

monthly.title: Monthly Expenses
monthly.subTitle: Enter total amount of combined monthly expenses for all borrowers.
monthly.mostBorrowers:
The usage of 55% is an estimate based on certain averages of monthly income spent on other expenses. Please always confirm the $ amount with your customer(s) before proceeding. If the customer(s) state the amount is reasonable based on their normal monthly expenses for this category to proceed forward, if not, please update accordingly.

Other Monthly expenses: Is an estimate of all the other monthly expenses excluding liabilities/debt repayment already accounted for.

coverages.title: Existing Coverages
coverages.disabilityTooltip: Include Insurance coverage either through an individual or employer plan (LTD).
coverages.lifeTooltip: Include any insurance coverage either through an individual or employer plan.
coverages.infoBoxContent: Disability insurance is provided by most large employers and referred to as long-term disability (LTD). Customers should confirm their LTD coverage benefit with their employers. Some employers may have a tiered LTD coverage based on different base salaries and/or roles. If your customer(s) permits you to use an estimated % in the LTD field, you can use 60% as an average percentage that their employer benefit may cover of their base salary. If an estimate is used, again, remind your customer to confirm this estimate with their employer later, since the tool can be updated.

results.title: Gap Analysis Results
results.subTitle: The Gap Analysis tool illustrates your ability to meet your debt obligations if you were to experience certain covered events with and without creditor coverage. Your lender representatives can work with you to help you determine the coverage options that suit your circumstances.

results.withoutSubTitle: Consider these results in relation to what you are accustomed to.
results.footerTitleOne: Borrower may benefit by reviewing Life Insurance
results.footerTitleTwo: Borrower may benefit by reviewing Disability Insurance
results.footerDescriptionOne: If you were to pass away, your loved ones may not be able to maintain their current lifestyle and there may not be enough funds to pay off loans. Having optional Life insurance through a protection plan can help pay off or reduce your loan balance and possibly help you preserve your savings and other insurance you may have for what they were intended. Take the time to review our optional Life insurance to give you one less thing to worry about
results.footerDescriptionTwo: With a reduction of income, you may not be able to maintain your lifestyle or need to access savings or funds from other sources. Creditor protection insurance can help cover your monthly loan payment with our disability options. Take the time to review our optional 100% or 50% Disability coverage to see how it can complement an existing coverage.
results.footerDescriptionThree: With a loss of income, you may not be able to maintain your lifestyle or need to access savings or funds from other sources. Creditor insurance protection can help cover your monthly loan payment with our Job Loss options. Take the time to review our optional Job Loss coverage.
results.footerDescriptionFour: If you were to experience a covered critical illness, you and your loved ones may not be able to maintain your current lifestyle and there may not be enough funds to pay off loans. Having critical illness protection can help pay off or reduce your loan balance and possibly help you preserve your savings and other insurance you may have for what they were intended. Take the time to review our optional Critical Illness insurance to give you one less thing to worry about. Note: You can’t have more critical illness coverage than life coverage.
results.languageMessage:
Canadian Premier Life Insurance Company, which operates under the brand name Securian Canada, is the insurer of this product and can be reached at 1‑877‑271‑8713 or www.canadianpremier.ca. 

The downloadable .pdf report will reflect the current language displayed on screen. 

The results are calculated and generated based on the accuracy and completeness of the data and information you have entered and provide an estimate only. 

 The results are intended for illustrative and general information purposes only, and do not constitute, nor should they be relied upon as, financial, or other advice. 

100% of the premiums are paid as part of all approved claims and is not subject to the benefit maximum. 

* Based on current loan payment and/or balance up to the maximum insured limit. Premiums are covered in addition to the P&I.
